movies.title: Javascript Tip Calculator
movies.shortDescription: Never do restaurant panic-math again.  This tip calculator app will calculate your tip every time. This is a great first app for new developers.  Use HTML5, JavaScript, and the Onsen UI library to build this simple application.

movies.title: Finger Paint App with HTML5 Canvas
movies.shortDescription: Put on your smock for this HTML5 Canvas Paint tutorial.  Create an HTML5 canvas paint App in this tutorial with Mark Lassoff.  You'll learn how to place the HTML5 canvas in your HTML code, the JavaScript you need to do HTML5 canvas drawing, and the necessary events to allow the user to finger paint on the HTML5 canvas.

movies.title: Make a Digital Clock... with a Twist
movies.shortDescription: In this video, you'll create a digital clock using JavaScript and the Date() object.  We'll also display local news headlines from an API using Fetch().

movies.title: Weather Conditions App
movies.shortDescription: Do you need to bring a jacket?  Create this weather conditions app and see the weather in any city on the face of the globe.  This app uses HTML5, JavaScript, the OnsenUI library and Open WeatherMap API.

movies.title: Make a Beer Pairing App
movies.shortDescription:
Which beer goes with pizza?  Red? White? A Nice Merlot? Make a Javascript app that uses an API to get data which you will display to the user.  This app will help you pair a beer with your food.

In this video, Mark will create a JavaScript app that will query the Punk API and display information about beers in its database.  You'll learn to make a JavaScript application as you're invited to code along with this video.

movies.title: Movie Tracker
movies.shortDescription: For the movie buff in all of us, this app lets you track movies you've seen as well as some information about those movies.  This app uses HTML5, JavaScript, the jQuery library, and localForage for storage.  Learn about client side storage as you build this app with Mark.

movies.title: Creating an App with the Google Maps API
movies.shortDescription: Learn how to create an app with the JavaScript API for Google Maps. This app first displays a map of the local area and then drops pins on the map where there are restaurants.  Click on a pin yields further information about each restaurant.    This application uses vanilla JavaScript and the Google Maps and Places APIs.

movies.title: Most Used Programming Languages 2019
movies.shortDescription: In this Framework Technical Report, Mark discusses the most used programming languages in 2019.  The most used programming languages in the world include JavaScript, Java, C% and PHP.

movies.title: iOS vs Android: Which Mobile OS Is Most Popular?
movies.shortDescription: iOS vs Android: Which Mobile OS Is Most Popular? Mark discusses the user base of iOS versus the user base of Android.  The numbers worldwide versus in the US are surprising.

movies.title: Coding For Kids: Where to Start
movies.shortDescription: There has been a large movement to teach coding for kids along with other critical STEM skills.  In this video Mark reports on options to learn programming for kids.

movies.title: The State of Online Video
movies.shortDescription: Online video has exploded over the last decade. In this report, Mark reviews the state of online video and what to expect in the near future

movies.title: Augmented Reality Versus Virtual Reality
movies.shortDescription: Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality are two different technologies used to represent the real world with digital augmentation, and a completely virtual world.  In this video, Mark will explain the difference between augmented reality and virtual reality.

movies.title: Python Variables Expressions And Statements
movies.shortDescription: The Framework Coding show provides a short code lesson in each episode, helping you learn contemporary coding skills quickly and easily. The Python programming language is an easy to learn, common but powerful programming language.  During the show, Mark will demonstrate the print() statement, how to use variables and expressions in Python.

movies.title: Python Conditional Statements
movies.shortDescription: In this episode of the Framework Coding Show, host Mark Lasssoff covers Python conditional statements.  The Framework Coding show provides a short code lesson in each episode, helping you learn contemporary coding skills quickly and easily.

movies.title: Lists and Tuples in Python
movies.shortDescription: In this episode of the Framework Coding Show, host Mark Lasssoff covers tuples and lists in Python. The Framework Coding show provides a short code lesson in each episode, helping you learn contemporary coding skills quickly and easily.

movies.title: Loops in Python
movies.shortDescription: In this episode of the Framework Coding Show, host Mark Lasssoff looks into loops in Python. The Framework Coding show provides a short code lesson in each episode, helping you learn contemporary coding skills quickly and easily.

movies.title: 7 Tips to Start Coding Today
movies.shortDescription: Are you wondering how to begin coding? Do you want to learn to program but haven't found the right place to start? In this video, join Framework's Mark Lassoff as he reviews 7 Tips to help you Begin Coding today. Mark will discuss how to get started if you want to learn to code and provide invaluable tips that will get you moving down the right path.

movies.title: Learn JavaScript in 1 Hour
movies.shortDescription: JavaScript might be the most important language you can learn right now. If you can learn JavaScript in 1 Hour, why not get started? This JavaScript programming course covers all the basics that you need to know to start coding in the JavaScript programming language. You are encouraged to code along with the instructor in order to learn step-by-step.

movies.title: Build an App From Scratch
movies.shortDescription: Join Mark Lassoff and Framework Television to Build an App From Scratch with JavaScript. In this video, Mark will create four versions of the application so you can see how core functionality is coded and additional features are added in new iterations. You'll see exactly how to build an app from start to finish as JavaScript and jQuery are used to create the project. The app itself is a random password generator, which allows you to create a password of any reasonable length and choose the types of characters that are included in the application. As the process of building an app continues, features are added to make the password generator more useful.

movies.title: How to Create a mySQL Database with PHPMyAdmin
movies.shortDescription: Mark shows you how to create a SQL Database using the SQLite database management system. In this video, you'll learn how to create a table and select fields to be stored. You'll also learn about the various data types available in mySQL.

movies.title: Augmented Reality with Reality Composer
movies.shortDescription: Learn how to create Augmented Reality applications with Apple's Reality Composer for Mac and iOS. Jeff Batt demonstrates taking a simple real-life sign and adding augmented reality features.

movies.title: Code Camp Day 001
movies.shortDescription: Welcome to Day One of the Covid-19 Code Camp. In this code camp, you'll learn the basics of programming, making web sites and digital design. If you're going to be stuck inside, you might as well make your time productive. Join Mark Lassoff and the cast of Framework Television for the free Covid-19 Code Camp. In this episode, you'll start coding in Python.

movies.title: Code Camp Day 002
movies.shortDescription: Welcome to Day Two of the Covid-19 Code Camp. In this code camp, you'll learn the basics of programming, making web sites and digital design. If you're going to be stuck inside, you might as well make your time productive. Join Mark Lassoff and the cast of Framework Television for the free Covid-19 Code Camp. In this episode, you'll continue learning the Python programming language.

movies.title: Code Camp Day 003
movies.shortDescription: Welcome to Day Three of the Covid-19 Code Camp. In this code camp, you'll learn the basics of programming, making web sites and digital design. If you're going to be stuck inside, you might as well make your time productive. Join Mark Lassoff and the cast of Framework Television for the free Covid-19 Code Camp. In this episode, we'll work with lists, tuples, and loops in the Python language.

movies.title: Code Camp Day 004
movies.shortDescription: Welcome to Day Four of the Covid-19 aCode Camp. In this code camp, you'll learn the basics of programming, making web sites and digital design. If you're going to be stuck inside, you might as well make your time productive. Join Mark Lassoff and the cast of Framework Television for the free Covid-19 Code Camp. In this episode, we'll work with our first data-structure: dictionaries.

movies.title: Code Camp Day 005
movies.shortDescription: Welcome to Day Five of the Covid-19 Code Camp. In this code camp, you'll learn the basics of programming, making web sites and digital design. If you're going to be stuck inside, you might as well make your time productive. Join Mark Lassoff and the cast of Framework Television for the free Covid-19 Code Camp. In this episode, you'll learn the details of Python functions. Mark will show you simple functions, parameterized functions, and functions that return a value.

movies.title: Code Camp Day 006
movies.shortDescription: Welcome to Day Six of the COVID-19 Code Camp. In this code camp, you'll learn the basics of programming, making web sites and digital design. If you're going to be stuck inside, you might as well make your time productive. Join Mark Lassoff and the cast of Framework Television for the free Covid-19 Code Camp. In this episode, you'll learn the details of Python classes and objects. Mark will demonstrate creating and instantiating a simple class and you'll create one of your own!

movies.title: Code Camp Day 007
movies.shortDescription: "Welcome to Day Seven of the COVID-19 Code Camp. In this code camp, you'll learn the basics of programming, making web sites and digital design. If you're going to be stuck inside, you might as well make your time productive. Join Mark Lassoff and the cast of Framework Television for the free COVID-19 Code Camp. In this episode, you'll learn more about Python classes and objects. Mark will demonstrate creating subclasses and parent-child relationships.

movies.title: Code Camp Day 008
movies.shortDescription: Welcome to Day Eight of the COVID-19 Code Camp. In this code camp, you'll learn the basics of programming, making web sites and digital design. If you're going to be stuck inside, you might as well make your time productive. Join Mark Lassoff and the cast of Framework Television for the free COVID-19 Code Camp. In this episode, you'll learn more about Python file I/O (Input/Output). Mark will demonstrate saving and loading files as well as CSV files.

movies.title: Atom Text Editor | Tool School 001
movies.shortDescription: David reviews one of our favorite text editors: Atom. Learn about this great tool and how you can use it to write code.

movies.title: Best Free Stock Photo Sites | Tool School 002
movies.shortDescription: Every web developer needs stock photos. David reviews resources with over 1 million free stock photos available.

movies.title: CSS Animations with Animista | Tool School 003
movies.shortDescription: Animista is a pretty cool tool that allows you to create CSS animations without writing a lot of complex code.

movies.title: Web Code Tools | Tool School 004
movies.shortDescription: Learn about a tool that actually helps you remember and write code!  David looks at code generators on this episode of Tool School!

movies.title: How to Create a Prototype... Fast | Tool School 005
movies.shortDescription: David discusses a number of tools you can use for rapid website prototyping.

movies.title: Productivity For Programmers | Tool School 006
movies.shortDescription: Mark reviews a number of tips to make programmers more productive on this episode of Tool School.

movies.title: Top CSS Libraries | Tool School 007
movies.shortDescription: CSS Libraries do a lot of the heavy lifting in your web site design. Review some top libraries with Mark in this video.

movies.title: Controlling Video with JavaScript | Framework Site Tour
movies.shortDescription: Learn how JavaScript is applied as Mark gives you a behind-the-scenes tour of the new Framework Website. Mark will discuss controlling video with javascript as he goes through the company's new video site line-by-line. You'll learn how to use a JSON feed to create a video catalog site that allows users to select and play videos in several different categories. The site uses the HTML5 video player, along with JavaScript controls.

movies.title: Google Identity Platform Tutorial: Build Episode 001
movies.shortDescription: Want an easy way to add authentication to your web site? In this premiere episode of BUILD, Ken Larson leads a Google Identity Platform Tutorial. Ken leads you through the process of registering your application with Google and then demonstrates the code used for authentication. There is no easier way to add authentication than the Google Cloud Identity Platform.

movies.title: Responsive with Navbar HTML CSS Jquery
movies.shortDescription: Learn how to build a responsive navbar (HTML CSS, jQuery) in this episode of CodeLab. Join CodeLab host Chris for this step-by-step tutorial on creating a responsive navbar. Chris will be using HTML, CSS, and jQuery to create the navbar. Using responsive design, the navbar created in the tutorial will be usable for large screens and mobile devices. You'll get all the HTML, CSS, and jQuery code to create the navbar and you are free to update the code to create your own responsive navbar design.

movies.title: Learn jQuery for Beginners: Build Episode 002
movies.shortDescription: Learn jQuery for Beginners. Join us this episode of Build where host Walt Dombrowski helps you learn jQuery. You don't need any previous experience to go through the techniques in this video, which is a jquery tutorial for beginners.

movies.title: How To Make Checkout Page In Html | CodeLab 004
movies.shortDescription: Learn How to Make Checkout Page in HTML. Join us this episode of CodeLab where host Mark Lassoff will show you how to make a checkout page in HTML. You don't need any previous experience to go through the techniques in this video, which uses HTML and CSS to build the checkout page.

movies.title: Phaser Project: Build Your First JavaScript Game with the Phaser Library | BUILD 003
movies.shortDescription: Learn to build games in JavaScript with this easy Phaser Project. Mark will take you step-by-step through building a game using HTML, JavaScipt, and the Phaser game library. You can use the code as a Phaser project template, as you continue to build your own games using JavaScript. Int he video Mark builds a simple target shooting game with the Phaser library. You'll learn how to display images and animations, play sounds, control with the keyboard, and much more.

movies.title: Bootstrap Flexbox Layout | CodeLab 005
movies.shortDescription: Learn how to create a complex Bootstrap Flex Layout. Using the techniques Jeff demonstrates in this video you'll learn how to create responsive layouts with Flexboxes in Bootstrap 4. This tutorial will use the flex layout technology with a Bootstrap layout.

movies.title: How To Build A Web Scraper In Python | CodeLab 006
movies.shortDescription: Learn how to create a complex Bootstrap Flex Layout. Using the techniques Jeff demonstrates in this video you'll learn how to create responsive layouts with Flexboxes in Bootstrap 4. This tutorial will use the flex layout technology with a Bootstrap layout.

movies.title: HTML5 Tips And Tricks
movies.shortDescription: In this video, Mark shows you a few HTML5 tips and tricks. You'll learn tricks such as using HTML5 column layout and HTML5 events. Mark will show you all the HTML5 code and any CSS and JavaScript needed to support these tips and tricks. The Framework Coding Show helps you learn to code featuring new tutorials designed for new developers.

movies.title: Getting Started With Bootstrap
movies.shortDescription: Join Walt for this Bootstrap tutorial where you'll learn about getting started with Bootstrap for page layout. If you want to learn Bootstrap, this video goes over seven power tips to help you use Bootstrap for web development.

movies.title: Text Editors For Web Development
movies.shortDescription: What's your favorite text editor? In this episode of the Framework Coding Show, Mark reviews his seven favorite text editors for web development and reveals this top pic. All of the text editors presented are great options for coders looking for text editors for Windows or the best text editors for Mac.

movies.title: JavaScript Web Services Tutorial
movies.shortDescription: In this episode of CodeLab, Mark provides a JavaScript Web Services Tutorial. You're invited to code along as Mark uses the News API to create this JavaScript web services application. You'll learn how to query the web service, use the JavaScript fetch API to contact the web service, and parse the JSON results that are returned. All the code from this web services tutorial is available to you.

movies.title: Animate CSS Tutorial
movies.shortDescription: Want to add animations to your web content? Join Jeff Batt on this week's episode of CodeLab to work with the animate.css framework. Jeff will offer a complete animate.css tutorial as he builds a page that includes several animated elements. You will work through several examples of using Animate CSS and Javascript to trigger animations with the Animate CSS Framework.

movies.title: Rule of Thirds
movies.shortDescription: Applying the rule of thirds will revolutionize how you layout pages and screens. Taken from Framework's Certified Digital Design Professional Program.
